attributes.action: Employ base on qualifications not by Brits, EU & others,in NHS(non medical role)
attributes.additional_details:
We come to UK(Non EU and Non Brits), bring our self up to speed by gaining a masters and other qualifications. When invited for interview, most Hiring Managers tells you outrightly, "you've done very well, but this is what the Government wants, Consider a British 1st, an EU 2nd before others", so we have little or no chance in getting a job in NHS in a non medical role.
The NHS only concentrate in employing Nurses and Doctors, they even employ from there countries, the Government should look into this.
attributes.background: The NHS & most Employers (public & private) has the Government instructions to consider 1st a British, 2nd an EU before considering others, they don't look at qualifications. I have been a victim this severally, and I can prove it. Employment should be on merit rather than color.

rejection.details:
It is is already illegal for employers to discriminate against EU workers in recruitment processes. You can find out how to take action against employers that have engaged in discrimination here: https://www.equalityhumanrights.com/en/multipage-guide/dealing-discrimination-employment

We could accept a petition calling for a public inquiry into NHS or all recruitment, to investigate concerns that UK citizens are being given priority over EU citizens and other non-UK nationals entitled to work in the UK.
